Label: Amendment
Definition: A label to indicate a test of type AMENDMENT which may propose a change or addition to at least one Darwin Core term that is intended to improve one or more components of the quality of the record.

Label: CORE
Definition: Tests for evaluating biodiversity data quality as represented by the values of Darwin Core terms. CORE tests address identified user needs, are widely applicable, informative, unambiguous, well defined, and straight forward to implement.

Label: Darwin Core Class
Definition: The Information Element in the original terms of the framework, the general sort of information this test operates on.

Label: Data Quality Dimension
Definition: The data quality dimension for this test. See bbqffdq:DataQualityDimension.

Label: Description
Definition: A non-technical description of what the test does, intended for consumers of data quality reports in concert with the bdq:Response.comment.

Label: DO NOT IMPLEMENT
Definition: Tests that are not CORE (cf. bdqtag:CORE) and not recommended to be implemented with the current level of understanding for one or more reasons: Available vocabularies are ambiguous; the test is too complex to implement concisely; implementation is expected to lead to ambiguous or inaccurate results.

Label: Example Implementations (Mechanisms)
Definition: Known Mechanisms with implementations of the test.

Label: Examples
Definition: A ’pass’ and a ‘fail’ example of test data. All examples listed are present in the the validation data suite.

Label: Expected Response
Definition: The specification for implementors describing the expected behavior of the test. See bdqffdq:Specification

Label: GUID
Definition: see bdq:GUID

Label: Immature/Incomplete
Definition: Tests where substantial work is needed to develop the specification to the point where the test can be reliably and usefully implemented. This may indicate work that is wholly internal to the test specification such as developing a consistent Expected Response, or may indicate that external work is needed to develop an agreed vocabulary for values of the tested term. An immature/incomplete test may be made CORE, Supplementary, or DO NOT IMPLEMENT when relevant criteria are satisfied.

Label: Information Elements Acted Upon
Definition: A list of the specific Darwin Core terms that are the focus of a test.

Label: Information Elements Consulted
Definition: AA list of Darwin Core terms that are consulted in the evaluation of the Information Elements ActedUpon.

Label: ISO/DCMI STANDARD
Definition: A reference to either an ISO (International Organization for Standardization) Standard or a DCMI (Dublin Core Metadata Initiative) Standard

Label: Issue
Definition: A label to indicate a test of type ISSUE, where potential problems are flagged and may need examination by the user to determine if data have quality for their use.

Label: Label
Definition: A human readable label identifying the test. The labels largely follow the pattern TYPE_INFORMATIONELEMENT_STATUS.

Label: Link to Specification Source Code
Definition: A link to code that implements the test.

Label: Measure
Definition: A label to indicate a test of type MEASURE that performs a measurement according to some data quality dimension.

Label: NAME
Definition: A label to indicate that the test is related to Darwin Core terms in the dwc:Taxon Class.

Label: NEEDS WORK
Definition: A label that indicates that an issue (Test) requires more work before finalising.

Label: Notes
Definition: Additional, non-normative comments that the Task Group believed necessary for an accurate understanding of the test or issues that implementers needed to be aware of.

Label: OTHER
Definition: A label to indicate that the test is related to Darwin Core terms other than Classes dwc:Taxon, dwc:Location or dwc:Event.

Label: Parameterized
Definition: A label for a test that requires a bdq:Parameter to be set prior to a bdq:parameterizedTest being run.

Label: Parameter(s)
Definition: Any parameters that change the behavior of the test for a subset of users with special data quality needs within the domain.

Label: References
Definition: A list of references pertinent to the test.

Label: Source
Definition: The origin of the concept of the test.

Label: Source Authority
Definition: A reference to an external (non-Darwin Core) authority required for the test.  See bdq:sourceAuthority

Label: SPACE
Definition: A label to indicate that the test is related to Darwin Core terms in the dwc:Location Class.

Label: Specification Last Updated
Definition: The last date a change was made to a test that affects the operation of the test.

Label: Supplementary
Definition: Tests regarded as not CORE (cf. bdqtag:CORE) because of one or more reasons: Not widely applicable; not clearly matched to an identified data quality need; not informative concerning the 'quality' or lack of quality of the data; likely to return a high percentage of either bdq:NOT_COMPLIANT or bdq:POTENTIAL_ISSUE records. A Supplementary test MAY be implemented in a local implementation if a suitable use case exists.
Comment: A Supplementary test may be made CORE at a later time.

Label: Term-Actions
Definition: Equivalent to the bdqTestField:Label without the leading Test Type.

Label: Test
Definition: Tests descriptions created by TG2, either CORE, Immature/Incomplete, Supplementary, or DO NOT IMPLEMENT.

Label: Test Type
Definition: The Type of assertion that the test produces, Measure, Validation, Amendment, Issue.

Label: TG1
Definition: Issues pertinent to Task Group 1 ([Framework on Data Quality](https://tdwg.github.io/bdq/tg1/site)) of the TDWG Data Quality Interest Group.

Label: TG2
Definition: Issues including Tests, developed by, or pertinent to Task Group 2 ([Data Quality Tests and Assertions](https://github.com/tdwg/bdq/blob/master/tg2/README.md)) of the TDWG Data Quality Interest Group.

Label: TG3
Definition: Issues pertinent to Task Group 3 ([Data Quality Use Cases](https://github.com/tdwg/bdq/blob/master/tg3/README.md)) of the TDWG Data Quality Interest Group.

Label: TG4
Definition: Issues pertinent to Task Group 4 ([Best Practices for Development of Vocabularies of Value](https://github.com/tdwg/bdq/blob/master/tg4/README.md)) of the TDWG Data Quality Interest Group.

Label: TIME
Definition: A label to indicate that the test is related to Darwin Core terms in the dwc:Event Class.

Label: Validation
Definition: A label to indicate a test of type VALIDATION that describes a run of a test for validity against a set of criteria.

Label: VOCABULARY
Definition: A label to indicate that a bdqlabel:Test requires a Vocabulary

Label: dwc:
Definition: A namespace to indicate Darwin Core terms and which are listed in the dwcffdq:InformationElements of each Test.

Label: EPSG
Definition: A pseudo-namespace referenced in dwc:datum to indicate the EPSG API where the numeric value following the colon is used as the search key. Example: EPSG:4326.

Label: gbif:
Definition: A pseudo-namespace referenced in dwc:taxonID to indicate the GBIF API where the numeric value following the colon is used as the search key. Example: gbif:8102122.

Label: label
Definition: See: https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf-schema/#ch_label

Label: Preferred Label
Definition: See https://www.w3.org/TR/skos-reference/#labels.
Comment: from SKOS Simple Knowledge Organization System

Label: non-printing characters
Definition: ASCII 0-32 and 127 decimal. Non printing characters or formatting marks that are not displayed at printing. These may include pilcrow, space, non-breaking space, tab character. etc. For the purposes of the tests they are treated as bdq:EMPTY.

Label: null
Definition: A value that is used in some databases to signify that a value is unknown or missing. It may be represented in serializations by "NULL", "Null", "null". "/n", "9999", etc. These should be treated as bdq:NOTEMPTY.

Label: Roman numerals
Definition: Roman numerals are interpreted as the equivalent integer for months (e.g. "X" as "10") in appropriate tests. Roman numerals may not be unambiguously interpreted for other Darwin Core terms such as dwc:day or in text fields as they may mean unknown or something else entirely.

Label: white space
Definition: 1) A field that only includes white space (blanks) is treated as bdq:EMPTY (_q.v._). 2) In bdqffdq:Validation tests (_q.v._) that require the looking up of a bdq:sourceAuthority, leading and/or trailing white space will cause the test to fail as no preprocessing is carried out on the data. These leading and trailing white spaces may be stripped out in a subsequent bdqffdq:Amendment and thus pass when the bdqffdq:Validation test is run again.

Label: dataID
Definition: The local (to bdq:ValidationData) integer indentifier for the Validation Data record

Label: LineForTest
Definition: A local to bdq:ValidationData identifier for test records within one test

Label: LineNumber
Definition: The sequence number of the data record in the bdq:ValidationData

Label: COORDINATES
Definition: A general category of specific bdq:InformationElements that represents the combination of the Darwin Core terms dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude and may include metadata terms including dwc:geodeticDatum.

Label: GEOGRAPHY
Definition: A general category of specific bdq:InformationElements that represents a combination of Darwin Core administrative geography terms dwc:continent, dwc:country, dwc:countryCode, dwc:stateProvince, dwc:county, dwc:municipality.

Label: POLYNOMIAL
Definition: A general category of specific bdq:InformationElements that represents a combination of the Darwin Core terms dwc:genericName, dwc:specificEpithet, dwc:infraspecificEpithet.

Label: VERBATIM
Definition: A general category of specific bdq:InformationElements that represents a term containing a original value.

Label: YEARMONTHDAY
Definition: A general category of specific bdq:InformationElements that represents a combination of the Darwin Core terms dwc:year, dwc:month, dwc:day.

Label: YEARSTARTDAYOFYEARENDDAYOFYEAR
Definition: A general category of specific bdq:InformationElements that represents a combination of the Darwin Core terms dwc:year, dwc:startDayOfYear, dwc:endDayofYear.

Label: ASSUMEDDEFAULT
Definition: A bdqffdq:Amendment that replaces a bdq:EMPTY term with a predefined default bdq:Parameter value.
Comment: Would be used only in an extension or in bdq:Response.comment, bdq:Response.status value for this case is bdq:AMENDED.

Label: CONSISTENT
Definition: Identifies inconsistency among values between bdqffdq:InformationElements.

Label: CONVERTED
Definition: A conversion has been proposed to values in the bdqffdq:InformationElements to conform with a targeted reference system.

Label: FOUND
Definition: The value in a bdqffdq:InformationElement that matched a value in a bdq:sourceAuthority.
Comment: Use bdq:COMPLIANT for bdq:Response.result, and include this in bdq:Response.comments or bdq:Response.qualifier.

Label: OUTOFRANGE
Definition: The value in a bdqffdq:InformationElement that is outside an acceptable range for that bdqffdq:InformationElement.

Label: PRECISIONINSECONDS
Definition: The length of the period of an event in seconds.
Comment: This is description of the bdq:Response.result from this bdqffdq:Measure, where the result is a numeric value in seconds. See Test "MEASURE_EVENTDATE_DURATIONINSECONDS" (56b6c695-adf1-418e-95d2-da04cad7be53).

Label: PREREQUISITESNOTMET
Definition: A test of type bdqffdq:Measure that counts the number of tests of type bdqffdq:Validation that did not run due to one or more prerequisites not being met (e.g. bdq:INTERNAL_PREREQUISITES_NOTMET and bdq:EXTERNAL_PREREQUISITES_NOTMET)

Label: PROPOSED
Definition: A test of type bdqffdq:Measure that pertains to a bdqffdq:Amendment where an action to modify a value in some way through a change or addition is recommended.

Label: STANDARD
Definition: A bdqffdq:Amendment where a value in a bdqffdq:InformationElement is proposed from a bdq:sourceAuthority.

Label: STANDARDIZED
Definition: A bdqffdq:Amendment where a bdq:STANDARD value for a bdqffdq:InformationElement is proposed.
Comment: Use bdq:AMENDED as the bdq:Response.status, report bdq:STANDARDIZED in a bdq:Response.qualifier or in a bdq:Response.comment.

Label: TERRESTRIALMARINE
Definition: A terrestrial taxon that has geographic coordinates that fall within terrestrial boundaries; or a marine taxon that has geographic coordinates that fall within marine boundaries.
Comment: Use bdq:AMENDED as the bdq:Response.status, report bdq:TERRESTRIALMARINE in a bdq:Response.qualifier or in a bdq:Response.comment. See test "VALIDATION_COORDINATES_TERRESTRIALMARINE" (b9c184ce-a859-410c-9d12-71a338200380).

Label: TRANSPOSED
Definition: The sign and/or value of one or more bdqffdq:InformationElements were swapped.
Comment: Use bdq:AMENDED as the bdq:Response.status, report bdq:TRANSPOSED in a bdq:Response.qualifier or in a bdq:Response.comment. See Test "AMENDMENT_COORDINATES_TRANSPOSED" (f2b4a50a-6b2f-4930-b9df-da87b6a21082).

Label: EMPTY
Definition: A bdqffdq:InformationElement that is either not present or does not contain any characters or values other than those in the range U+0000 to U+0020.
Comment: Note: A bdqffdq:InformationElement containing invalid characters (e.g. letters in an information element that would be expected to contain integers) or values (including string serializations of the NULL value) are NOT_EMPTY and may be separately detected.

Label: NOTEMPTY
Definition: The value of a bdqffdq:InformationElement that is present and has content  (cf. bdq:EMPTY)

Label: paramaterizedTest
Definition: A test that allows a bdq:Parameter to be set prior to the test being run. Where a bdq:Parameter value has not been provided, a default is specified within the test.

Label: testFields
Definition: Column heading in the markdown of the tests in the bdq GitHub that list all the normative and informative metadata elements that describe a Data Quality Test

Label: TestPrerequisite
Definition: Conditions that must be met for a test to be run (e.g., fields having values, tests that need to be run before the current test, availability of a bdq:sourceAuthority)
Comment: See for example, INTERNAL_PREREQUISTES_NOT_MET (_q.v._) and EXTERNAL_PREREQUISITES_NOT_MET (_q.v._).

Label: TestType
Definition: There are four types of tests, viz. bdqffdq:Validation, bdqffdq:Amendment, bdqffdq:Issue, and bdqffdq:Measure.

Label: Examples
Definition: Provide one pass (e.g. COMPLIANT) example and one fail (e.g. NON_COMPLIANT) example for each test.

Label: CRS
Definition: Coordinate Reference System - A coordinate system defined in relation to a standard reference or datum (Chapman & Wieczorek (2020)).

Label: geodetic datum
Definition: "A mathematical model that uses a reference ellipsoid to describe the size and shape of the surface of the earth and adds to it the information needed for the origin and orientation of coordinate systems on that surface Chapman and Wieczorek (2000))."

Label: A coordinate reference system based on a geodetic datum, used to describe positions on the surface of the earth (Chapman and Wieczorek (2020)).
Definition: Test
